bboxes.raw_text:
10 minutes, he was reclining in
the hydraulic bed.


When | left him, he was
bit displea sed because his meals
were restricted until the next
noontime. | could tell that he
was not too i'll, for a man and
his appetite are sure signs of
Improvement.


Saturday and Sunday passed
very rapidly between dashes from
the hospital to home. | sand
wiched a couple Of stops at the
store and the cleaners during
the hours. OF course, the post
Thanksgiving dinner was post
poned.


Monday started as any other
Monday. For two weeks have
been pitting salve, capsules and
stamina against an allergic con-
dition. My hands and feet became
the backgrounds = for a day
they itched and we're swollen.


Monday evening was disturbed
by a series of sneezes. The nurse
at Good Samaritan thought was
catching a cold. So did my hus-
band. | assured them that some
thing was not agreeing with my
sensitive system.


Upon returning home | felt
a tickle in my throat..l had eaten
a quarter slice of an apple
suddenly my hands and feet ting
led. Just then the telephone rang.


could hardly talk and | had to
break off suddenly, gulping two
allergy pills. Within fifteen min
utes l had jumped into our car
and driven myself to the emer-
gency room at Good Samaritan
Hospital.


All is we'll again--My spouse
feels better, my itches are gone
but the goose remains in the
butcher s freezer.


l forgot = Thursday night
medium sized toad was crouched
in our bathroom near the bath
rub. He had entered unnoticed

welcomed me and introduced me
to their children and friends.
Since, | was a bit late--1 was
starting on my first course when
most of them were finishing.


The menu really had from soup
to nuts on 1t. There we're tur-
key, goose, beef, lamb or lob
ster for main dishes. You could
prime your palate with fruit
sherbet cocktail, cream ofmush-
room soup, seafood cocktail or
one Of the hundred bottles Of
vintage wines.


Vegetables ranged from
mashed potatoes to tiny creamed
onions. Two kinds of salads we're
available, plus hot rolls and
breads served continuously by
smiling waiter.


Desserts are usually ones
piece de resistance--and | sue
cumbed to a generous slice of
pumpkin pie with cheddar cheese
(being displaced Hoosier, was
unable to destroy the spicy pump
kin flavor with bit of cheese).
) After dinner you could relax
over a dish of roquefort cheese
and crackers and drink coffee,
tea, milk homogenized or non
fat), beef broth, hot or cold,
Sanka or pure water.


Fruit cake, plum pudding, pink
champagne sherbet, pecan ice
cream, jumbo dates, chilled
grapes, sailed nuts or a hand
full Of minis we're other des-
sert entries.


: Mrs. Stewart sent two large
boxes of dinner to my spouse.
Joined him in a second feast
and commented on the grand
meal | had eaten earlier at the
Comeback Inn.


Friday was another full day.
Edward had an appointment to
enter the hospital. We arrived
at the admitting office of Good
Samaritan at l:45 p.n.. within

while was checking the car
port Storeroom.


My holiday spirits we're really
lifted after l had talked long
distance to my beloved Mother
and Grandmother. Their voices
made me forget most of the hec-
tic and marrying events of the
past days and nights.


True life stories seldom make
headlines unless something STU
pendous happens - but I'll bet
your days could match any
dramas concocted by story
makers.


Who needs a diary7 ustkeep-
ing living and enjoying the best
of it, remembering the most of
it and forgetting the worst OF 1t.

or recent experience
on century series aircraft

l.. Engine run certification
2. Ground support equipment


certification
8. Familiar with procedures


of AIM Col
